Injury by Use of Vehicle with PAC

result.execSummary:
The defendant Carla A Castrova was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Carla A Castrova is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Carla A Castrova was found guilty of Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court Costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Not to be present on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol.(bars, taverns or liquor stores)
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided.

Restitution to be determined at Restitution Hearing on 6/18/2015 @ 2:30PM

AS OF 7/13/2015: $6,224.16 was ordered as Restitution to Heidi B. and $405.36 to Ron B. (for a total of $6,629.53) to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Another hearing is set for August 24, 2015 at 1:30pm.

AS OF 8/25/2015: Stipulation filed to add additional restitution of $5,000.00 (to State Farm Insurance)

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Attendance to Victim Impact Meeting to be done on Extended Supervision.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 4/23/15 Sentencing
for restitution.

Defendant Carla A Castrova not in court.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Murphy not in court at 1:57 p.m.. Court finds there is not any additional restitution and sets any remaining restitution at zero. Prepare an amended Judgment of Conviction.
Restitution hearing on August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Br. 9

Defendant Carla A Castrova in court via video with attorney Mark P Murphy.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is agreeable to Ron B.'s restitution of $405.36. Defense stipulates to this amount.   Issue is with Heidi B.'s restitution. Atty. Tom Ogerchuck presents statements as to Heidi B.. Submission of claim is $6,169.16 for Heidi B.. Defense is not disputing this amount. Court is persuaded to warrant the award of $6,169.16 including the $55.00 which is not disputed. State Farm Agent Ned M. presents statements. State Farm did not file any paperwork to Atty. Murphy. Court takes a short break so parties can discuss some issues. Court reconvenes. Atty. Murphy needs to discuss this matter with State Farm. Parties will continue to discuss the matter and come to a resolution. Defense needs to speak to his client. Court has jurisdiction over this claim. Written stipulation may be filed. Defendant to appear by Video on the next date. Court orders the Judgment of Conviction be amended to $6224.16 restitution to Heidi B..  Restitution hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Carla A Castrova in court with attorney Mark P Murphy.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 2.


Court orders the following: 
Ct. 2:
- Total sentence: 9 years (Initial Confinement: 4 years, Extended Supervision: 5 years) 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 2 year Drivers License Revocation. 
- 2 year Ignition Interlock on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel meeting each year while on Extended Supervision
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision
- Restitution to be determined at restitution hearing
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision
- Conditions of Extended Supervision:  Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.  No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns or liquor stores). Defendant to perform 30 hours of community service. Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided.
Defendant's sentencing submittal filed by Attorney Murphy.

Request for an extenson to file PSI until 4/17/15.
Request approved by Judge Aprahamian.
Sentencing hearing on April 23, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
2 statements filed by the State
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Carla A Castrova in court with attorney Mark P Murphy.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 1, 3, 4 and 5 dismissed and read-in. Ct. 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10 dismissed by operation of law. Court orders a Presentence Investigation to be compiled and filed within 30 days. Court will set a sentencing date in 45 days. Bail remains as fixed. If this date is not good with the victims, State may request another date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
